Processing news and denunciations about domestic violence behavior

1. Police and border guard agencies near the place where domestic violence occurred when receiving news and denunciations, within the scope of their powers must promptly prevent and handle domestic violence according toauthorization;At the same time, notify the President of the People's Committee of the commune where the acts of domestic violence occurred.

2. Organizations and individuals specified at Points C, D, D and e, Clause 1, Article 19 of this Law when receiving notice and denouncing domestic violence must immediately notify the Chairman of the People's CommitteeThe commune -level people where domestic violence occurs and their ability to participate in preventing domestic violence.

3. The president of the commune -level People's Committee is responsible for processing or assigning it right after receiving the news, denouncing the acts of domestic violence or receiving a report on the group's acts of domestic violence.officials and individuals specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, except for the case specified in Clause 4 of this Article.

In case of reporting and denouncing the acts of domestic violence that people with violence are children, pregnant women, women who are raising children under 36 months of age, elderly people, people with disabilities, people who do not have the ability toSelf -care or acts of domestic violence have or have the potential to endanger the health and lives of people with violence, the presidents of the commune -level People's Committee assigns the police of communes, wards and townships (The following is collectively called the commune police) handling.

4. In case of reporting and denouncing criminals, the reception and handling of notices and denunciations shall comply with the provisions of the law on criminal proceedings.

5. The process of receiving and handling notice and denunciations on domestic violence acts comply with the Government's regulations.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Use sound and images of domestic violence

1. People with sound and images of domestic violence have the right to supply to competent agencies, organizations and individuals to resolve the case of domestic violence.

2. The use of sound and images of domestic violence in the process of resolving domestic violence and posting on the mass media, the internet must be consent of the violent person.Families or guardians, legal representatives of people with domestic violence, unless otherwise provided for by law.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Forced to end domestic violence

1. Persons competent to settle domestic violence cases may immediately apply necessary measures in accordance with the law to end domestic violence.

2. The person present at the place where domestic violence occurred according to his ability and the nature of domestic violence acts are responsible for asking people who commit domestic violence to immediately stop violent acts.family.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Ask people who commit domestic violence to the commune police headquarters where domestic violence occurred

1. When assigned to resolve the case, the Chief of the Commune Police has the right to request the person who commits domestic violence to go to the commune police headquarters where the domestic violence occurs to clarify information and resolve.The case in the following cases:

a) People with domestic violence are children, pregnant women, women who are raising children under 36 months of age, the elderly, people with disabilities, people who are unable to take care of themselves;

b) When there are grounds to think that domestic violence has or may continue to endanger the health and life of people with domestic violence.

2. The request for people who commit domestic violence to the commune police headquarters must be recorded and have people in the community witnessed.

3. In case a person who has a domestic violence does not comply with the request, the commune police may use the support tool in accordance with the law to bring the person who committed domestic violence to the commune police headquarters..

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Prohibited contacts according to the decision of the Chairman of the People's Committee of the commune

1. The president of the People's Committee of the commune where domestic violence occurred decided to apply the ban on contact each time no more than 03 days in the following cases:

a) There is a proposal of a person with domestic violence, guardian or legal representative of a person with domestic violence or agency, organization or individual authority for domestic violence acts.Harm or threaten to harm health or life -threatening of domestic violence.

In case the competent authority, organizations and individuals must have the consent of people with domestic violence or guardians or legal representatives of people with domestic violence;

b) Domestic violence acts that threaten the life of people with domestic violence.

2. Within 12 hours after receiving the request specified at Point a, Clause 1 of this Article, the President of the commune -level People's Committee shall consider and decide on the application of measures to ban contact;In case of not making a decision, a written notice must be notified and clearly stated the reason for agencies, organizations and people who propose to know.

3. The decision to prohibit the contact effect immediately after signing the promulgation and is sent to the person who commits domestic violence, people with domestic violence, the head of the commune police, the head of the village, the head of the residential group where the residential area is located.residence of people with domestic violence.

4. The president of the commune -level People's Committee issued a decision to ban the competent contact with the cancellation of the decision to ban contact.The cancellation of the decision prohibits contact in the following case:

a) There is a request of the person requesting to issue a decision to ban contact specified at Point a, Clause 1 of this Article;

b) People with domestic violence, guardian or legal representative of a domestic violence disagreement with the decision to ban contact specified at Point b, Clause 1 of this Article;

c) When considering this measure is no longer necessary.

5. When applying the decision to ban contact, people with domestic violence, guardian or legal representative of people with domestic violence are entitled to choose accommodation during the time of banning contact.

6. In case a person who commits domestic violence violates the decision to ban contact, the person may apply for temporary detention according to administrative procedures to prevent domestic violence in accordance with the Government's regulations.

7. In case the family has a wedding, a funeral or other special case where people who have domestic violence should contact with people with domestic violence, people who have domestic violence must notify toThe person assigned to monitor the implementation of the exposure ban and commitment not to let domestic violence.

8. The Government details this.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Prohibited contact according to the Court's decision

1. The People's Court is accepting or resolving a civil case between people with domestic violence and people who commit domestic violence to decide to apply contacts for no more than 04 months when there isEnough the following conditions:

a) Domestic violence acts that harm or threaten to harm the health or life threats of people with domestic violence;

b) There is a request of a person with domestic violence or guardian, legal representative of a person with domestic violence or competent authorities, organizations and individuals.

In case the competent authority, organizations and individuals must be required, they must be consent of people with domestic violence or guardians or legal representatives of people with domestic violence.

2. The People's Court is accepting or resolving a civil case between people with domestic violence and people who commit domestic violence themselves to issue a decision to ban contact within a period of no more than 04 months when needed to be told.The life of people with domestic violence.

3. The decision to prohibit the contact effect immediately after signing the promulgation and sent to the person who commits domestic violence, people with domestic violence, presidentsThe head of the village, the head of the residential group of the residence of the person with domestic violence and the People's Procuracy of the same level.

4. The Court issues a decision to ban contact specified in Clause 1 of this Article to cancel the decision to ban contact when the request of the person with domestic violence or the guardian, the legal representative of the personDomestic violence or competent authority, organizations, organizations

5. The Court issues a decision to ban contact specified in Clause 2 of this Article, cancel the decision to ban contact when it is found that this measure is no longer necessary.

6. If the family has a wedding, a funeral or other special cases where people who have domestic violence should contact with domestic violence, people who have domestic violence must notifyThe person assigned to monitor the implementation of the exposure ban and commitment not to let domestic violence.

7. Competence, order and procedures for application, change and cancellation measures for the exposure of this Article shall comply with the provisions of the law on civil proceedings.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Supervise the implementation of the decision to ban contact

1. When receiving the decision to ban contact specified in Article 25 and Article 26 of this Law, the commune police shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the head of the village, the head of the residential group and the relevant organization at the grassroots level for the director.Close to the implementation of the decision to ban contact and assign the supervisor of the implementation of the decision to ban contact.

2. The person assigned to supervise is responsible for monitoring the implementation of the decision to ban contact.When detecting people who commit domestic violence violating the decision to prohibit contact, the person assigned to supervise may require the person who committed domestic violence to strictly implement the decision to ban contact;In case of continuing violation, notify the Chief of the Commune Police for handling in accordance with the law.

3. In case the person who has acts of domestic violence is exposed to people with domestic violence specified in Clause 7, Article 25 and Clause 6, Article 26 of this Law, the other member of the family is responsible for supervision forensure no domestic violence.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Arrange temporary shelter and support essential needs

1. Persons with domestic violence are arranged temporarily shunned by the President of the People's Committee of the commune or by the agency, organizations and individuals voluntarily.

2. People with domestic violence are supported with essential needs in accordance with the law on social assistance.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Care and treatment of people with domestic violence

1. The following responsible medical examination and treatment facility:

a) Receive, screen, classify, care for and treat patients who are people with domestic violence;

b) Provide information on the health damage of people with domestic violence at the request of that person or the competent agency, organization or individual.

2. Health staff in the process of caring and treating patients, if the patient is found to show signs of domestic violence, shall immediately report to the head of the medical examination and treatment facility.

3. Domestic violence prevention and control facilities prescribed at Points a, c, dd and e, Clause 2, Article 35 of this Law, based on the functions and tasks responsible for caring for people with domestic violence..

4. The head of the supporting facility for prevention and control of domestic violence is responsible for notifying the commune police where the facility is located in case the person who is cared for and treated shows signs of domestic violence to protect, handling in accordance with the law.

relevant_article.law_id: Lu·∫≠t Ph√≤ng, ch·ªëng b·∫°o l·ª±c gia ƒë√¨nh 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Legal assistance and psychological advice, skills to cope with domestic violence

1. People with domestic violence are provided by the State Legal Assistance Center or organize the legal assistance to provide legal assistance services in accordance with the law on legal aid.

2. People with domestic violence are provided with psychological and skills consulting services to respond to domestic violence according to the Government's regulations.

3. The State encourages organizations and individuals to provide free consulting services for people with domestic violence.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Perform the work of serving the community

1. Community service is a small -scale job directly serving the interests of the community where people have domestic violence, including:

a) Participate in planting and tending trees in public areas;repairing and cleaning villages, alleys, streets, alleys, cultural houses, community houses or other public works;

b) Participate in other jobs to improve the living environment and landscape of the community.

2. The list of work prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article is recognized by the President of the commune -level People's Committee on the basis of discussion and decision of the community in accordance with the law on the implementation of democracy in the opportunity.Department.

3. The presidents of the People's Committee of the commune where people commit domestic violence to decide and organize the person who committed domestic violence to perform the work of serving the community.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Protect participants in the prevention and control of domestic violence and people informing and denouncing domestic violence

1. The President of the commune -level People's Committee is responsible for organizing measures to protect people directly participating in the prevention and control of domestic violence, who reported and denounced domestic violence.

2. Agencies, organizations and individuals receiving notice and denunciations of domestic violence are responsible for protecting the confidentiality of the personal information of the report and denouncing.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Truthful address

1. Reliable addresses are reputable organizations and individuals, their ability and voluntary to help domestic violence.

2. Organizations and individuals specified in Clause 1 of this Article notify the commune -level People's Committee on receiving a reliable address.The commune -level People's Committee made a list and announced a reliable address in the management area;guide and organize training for reliable addresses on domestic violence prevention and control.

3. When receiving people with domestic violence, the reliable address must notify the commune -level People's Committee.

The commune -level People's Committee is responsible for protecting and supporting funds for reliable addresses as prescribed by law.

4. The Vietnam Fatherland Front Committee and member organizations of the Front, social organizations are responsible for propagating and mobilizing organizations and individuals to participate as a reliable address in the community.residential.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Medical examination and treatment facility

1. Medical examination and treatment establishments perform the care and treatment of patients who are people with domestic violence as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 29 of this Law.

2. Public medical examination and treatment establishments, depending on the actual conditions arranging temporary places for patients who are people with domestic violence in the period of not exceeding 01 day at the request of people with domestic violence..

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Social assistance facilities, State legal aid centers, organized legal aid

1. Social assistance establishments carry out the care and support other necessary conditions for people with domestic violence during the time when people with domestic violence stay at the establishment as prescribed by law.

2. The State Legal Aid Center and the organization participate in legal aid to provide legal assistance services for people with domestic violence in accordance with the law on legal aid.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Other establishments participate in domestic violence prevention and control

1. The State encourages and creates conditions for individuals and organizations to participate in supporting domestic violence prevention and control.

2. Other establishments participate in supporting domestic violence prevention and control on contents and scope of activities with competent state agencies.

3. The Government details Clause 2 of this Article.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Handling violations of the law on prevention and control of domestic violence

1. Organizations and individuals that violate the law on domestic violence prevention and control, depending on the nature and seriousness of violations, are disciplined, sanctioned administrative violations or being examined.Criminal responsibility, if causing damage, compensation must be compensated according to the provisions of law.

2. In case the person who is sanctioned for administrative violations on violations of the law on prevention and control of domestic violence is cadres, civil servants, officials and people of the people's armed forces, the decision makerThe sanctioning is responsible for notifying the heads of agencies, organizations and units competent to manage that person.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Funds for domestic violence prevention and control

1. Finance for domestic violence prevention and control includes:

a) State budget;

b) Source of aid, donation, donation, contribution, support and support of domestic and foreign organizations and individuals in accordance with the law;

c) Other legal financial resources.

2. The state budget for domestic violence prevention and control is arranged in the annual budget estimate of the socio -political organization and organization assigned to the prevention and control of domestic violence..

3. The Government details Clause 2 of this Article and the content of spending and expenditure of domestic violence prevention and control activities guaranteed annually by the State budget.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Interdisciplinary coordination on domestic violence prevention and control

1. The head of the agency or organization is responsible for coordinating with the head of the state management agency on the prevention and control of domestic violence at the same level to implement and evaluate the results of the implementation of the tasks of prevention and control.Domestic violence.

2. Interdisciplinary coordination on domestic violence prevention and control is carried out on the basis of functions, tasks and powers of agencies and organizations, ensuring initiative and efficiency;Promote the responsibility of heads of agencies and organizations to participate in interdisciplinary coordination.

3. Interdisciplinary coordination activities on domestic and local domestic and local violence prevention and control are implemented in accordance with the Regulation on interdisciplinary coordination and the operation regulations of the Family Steering Committee at all levels by the Prime Minister.Government regulations.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Fostering knowledge and skills to participate in domestic violence prevention and control

1. Participants in the prevention and control of domestic violence are fostered with knowledge and skills on domestic violence prevention and knowledge and other necessary knowledge and skills related to domestic violence prevention and control.

2. Judges, jurors, Court Secretary, Procurators, Investigators, Commune Police, Village Heads, Residential Team Heads, Head of Front Task Force in Residential Area, Head of AssociationThe Union and the Steering Committee of the family work are fostered with knowledge, skills to prevent and combat domestic violence, gender equality in the prevention and control of domestic violence.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Content of state management on domestic violence prevention and control

1. Promulgating and submitting to competent authorities for promulgation and organizing the implementation of policies, laws and plans on domestic violence prevention and control.

2. Information, propagation, dissemination and education of law on domestic violence prevention and control.

3. Perform statistics on domestic violence prevention and control.

4. Training and fostering people working in the prevention and control of domestic violence.

5. Scientific research and international cooperation on domestic violence prevention and control.

6. Rewarding individuals and collectives with outstanding achievements in prevention and control of domestic violence.

7. Inspection, examination and settlement of complaints, denunciations and handling violations of domestic violence prevention and control.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibility of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism

1. Promulgating according to its competence or submitting to competent state agencies to promulgate legal documents, programs and plans on domestic violence prevention and control.

2. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with relevant agencies and organizations, organize the implementation of legal documents, programs and plans on domestic violence prevention and control;Interdisciplinary coordination on domestic violence prevention and control.

3. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with relevant agencies and organizations guiding consulting, information, education and communication;Compilation of sample documents to propagate and disseminate knowledge and skills on domestic violence prevention and control.

4. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with relevant agencies and organizations, organize the training of knowledge and skills for domestic violence prevention and control.

5. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the statistical work and database management on domestic violence prevention and control.

6. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with relevant agencies in, inspecting, examining and handling violations of the law on prevention and control of domestic violence.

7. Scientific research and international cooperation on domestic violence prevention and control.

8. Direct the construction, implementation, summarizing experiences, replicating the model of domestic violence prevention and control.

9. Guiding the contents of domestic violence prevention and control into the convention and convention of the community.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibilities of local governments at all levels

1. To direct and organize the implementation of the State management contents on domestic violence prevention and control according to local authorities.

2. Arranging funds and human resources to meet the requirements of performing domestic violence prevention and control tasks in the localities in accordance with this Law.

3. Every year, the People's Committees at all levels shall report to the People's Councils of the same level on the prevention and control of domestic violence in the locality.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibilities of the People's Court, the People's Procuracy at all levels

1. Protect the legitimate rights and interests of people with domestic violence.

2. Proactively prevent and promptly detect, prevent and handle violations of the law on domestic violence prevention and control.

3. Carry out fostering knowledge and skills on domestic violence prevention and control for judges, jurors, court secretaries and procurators.

4. Within the scope of their duties and powers, presiding over and coordinating with relevant agencies and organizations to propagate and educate policies and laws on domestic violence prevention and control.

5. Perform statistical work on prevention and control of domestic violence under its responsibility and send results to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibilities of the Vietnam Fatherland Front and member organizations

1. Social criticism and criticism;participate in social supervision and criticism in formulating and implementing policies and laws on domestic violence prevention and control.

2. Propagating, educating, encouraging and encouraging members, members and the masses to abide by the law on domestic violence prevention and control and other relevant laws.Carry out propaganda and educate skills to control domestic violence in agencies, organizations and people.

3. To propose necessary measures to relevant state agencies to implement the law on domestic violence prevention and control and other relevant laws;participate in prevention and control of domestic violence, care, support and protect people with domestic violence.

4. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate in prevention and control of domestic violence according to the provisions of this Law.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibility of the Vietnam Women's Union

1. To fulfill the responsibilities specified in Article 52 of this Law.

2. Consulting and participating in conciliation on the prevention and control of domestic violence at the grassroots level;Organize the implementation, connect and introduce consulting services, support people with domestic violence.

3. Organize activities to support livelihoods, create jobs or other support for people with domestic violence.

4. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the organization of domestic violence prevention and control facilities under the management scope;replicate the model of domestic violence prevention and control.

5. Coordinate with relevant agencies, organizations and individuals to protect and support domestic violent people who are women and children.

6. To coordinate the synthesis, statistical reports on women and children with domestic violence and send results to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibilities of social organizations, professional social organizations, economic organizations

1. Participate in monitoring the implementation of this Law.

2. Mobilizing and supporting resources to carry out the prevention and control of domestic violence.

3. Participate in propaganda, mobilizing members, members and masses to commit to not committing domestic violence, building happy families.

4. Participate in consulting and reconciliation in prevention and control of domestic violence, supporting people with domestic violence, educating people who commit domestic violence.

5. Receiving and collecting information from members, members, the masses and society to reflect, recommendations and advise agencies, organizations and individuals on the implementation of policies and lawson domestic violence prevention and control.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control 2022

relevant_article.article_text:
Effective

1. This law takes effect from July 1, 2023.

2. The Law on Domestic Violence Prevention and Control No. 02/2007/QH12 expires from the effective date of this Law.

Scope

This Law stipulates drug prevention and control;illegally manage narcotic substances;drug detoxification;responsibilities of individuals, families, agencies and organizations in drug prevention and control;State management and international cooperation on drug prevention and control.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Drug Prevention and Control 2021
relevant_article.article_text:
Explain words

In this law, the words below are understood as follows;

1. Narcotic substances are addictive substances, psychotropic substances prescribed in the list of narcotic substances issued by the Government.

2. Addictive substances are stimulants or neurological inhibitors, easily causing addiction to users.

3. Psychotropic substances are stimulants or neurological inhibitors or hallucinations, if used many times, it can lead to addiction to the user.

4. Pre -substance is an indispensable chemical in the process of preparing and producing narcotic substances specified in the list of precursors issued by the Government.

5. Veterinary drugs contain narcotic substances, precursors are veterinary drugs containing substances specified in Clauses 2, 3 and 4 of this Article.

6. Plants containing drugs are opium, Caoca, marijuana plants and other plants containing narcotic substances prescribed by the government.

7. Prevention and control of drugs is prevention, prevention and fight against crime and drug evils;Control legal activities related to drugs.

8. Drug evils are the illegal use of narcotics, drug addiction and acts of violating drug laws that are not to the extent or not being examined for penal liability.

9. Control of legal activities related to drugs is the permission, monitoring, inspection and supervision of legal activities related to drugs and prevention and preventing the abuse of such activitiesFor other purposes.

10. Illegal drug users who have acts of using narcotic substances without permission of a competent person or professional body and testing of narcotic substances in the body have positive results..

11. Testing of narcotic substances in the body is the implementation of professional techniques to identify narcotic substances in the body through urine samples, blood samples or other specimens of the human body.

12. Drug addicts are people who use drugs, addictive drugs, psychotropic drugs and are dependent on these substances.

13. Drug detoxification is the process of carrying out health, psychological and social support activities, helping drug addicts to stop using drugs, addictive drugs, psychotropic drugs, physical restoration., spirit, raising awareness, changing behaviors to stop the illegal use of these substances.

14. Drug detoxification establishment is the establishment establishment to fully implement the detoxification process in accordance with this Law, including public drug detoxification and voluntary drug detoxification establishments.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Drug Prevention and Control 2021
relevant_article.article_text:
State policies on drug prevention and control

1. To synchronously implement drug prevention and control measures;Combined with HIV/AIDS prevention and control and other social evils.

2. Strengthening propaganda and education on drug prevention and control;encourage organizations and individuals to participate in propaganda and education for drug prevention and control.

3. Prioritizing drug prevention and control resources for ethnic minority and mountainous areas, remote areas, islands, border areas and complex areas of drugs.

4. Officers and soldiers of the agency in charge of preventing and fighting against drug crimes and people working in drug detoxification in public drug detoxification facilities are entitled to appropriate preferential regimes and policiesWith the nature of the tasks and areas operating in accordance with the Government's regulations.

5. Protection and support for individuals, families, agencies and organizations to participate in drug prevention and control.

6. Strictly manage illegal users of narcotics and drug addicts;encourage drug addicts to voluntarily detoxify drugs, treat addicts of opium forms with alternative drugs;encourage individuals, families, agencies and organizations to participate, support drug detoxification activities, after -drug detoxification.

7. Ensuring compulsory drug detoxification funds;Support for voluntary drug detoxification and management funding after drug detoxification.

8. Organizations and individuals in the country and abroad invest in drug detoxification activities, support for post -detoxification management, drug relapse prevention and control are exempted from land rent, and income tax reduction, income taxEnterprises in accordance with the law.

9. Encouraging scientific research, technological development and high -tech application in drug prevention and control.

10. Rewarding individuals, organizations and agencies with achievements in drug prevention and control.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Drug Prevention and Control 2021
relevant_article.article_text:
Financial sources for drug prevention and control

1. State budget.

2. Source of funding, aid, investment and donation of domestic and foreign organizations and individuals.

3. Payment of family and drug addicts.

4. Other legal financial resources.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Drug Prevention and Control 2021
relevant_article.article_text:
The acts are strictly prohibited

1. Planting plants containing narcotic substances, instructions for planting trees containing narcotics.

2. Research, inspection, testing, testing, manufacturing, storing, transporting, preserving, storing, trading, distributing, processing, exchanging, exporting, importing, temporary import, temporary importre -export, temporary export, re -entry, illegal transit of narcotics, precursors, addictive drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursors, ingredients for drugs are addictive pharmacies, psychotropic substances, precursors for useMaking medicine, veterinary medicine contains narcotics and precursors.

3. Obsters of narcotic substances, precursors, addictive drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor medicine, medicinal ingredients are addictive pharmacies, psychotropic substances, precursors used as medicines, veterinary drugs containing substancesDrugs, precursors.

4. Delivery, management, control, storage, allocation and preservation of narcotics and precursors in contravention of law;Allow users to use narcotics, addictive drugs or psychotropic drugs to the provisions of the law.

5. Use and organize illegal use of narcotics;Forced, enticing other people to illegally use narcotics;Has, support the illegal use of narcotics.

6. Producing, storing, transporting, buying and selling vehicles and tools for illegal production or use of narcotics.

7. against or hinder the testing of narcotics in the body, determine the situation of drug addiction, illegally manage narcotics, drug detoxification, after -drug detoxification.

8. Revenge or hinder the person who performs the task of preventing and combating drugs and participants in drug prevention and control.

9. Taking advantage of positions, powers and occupations to violate the law on drug prevention and control.

10. Instructions for illegal production and instructions for using narcotics;advertising, narcotic marketing.

11. Illegally discriminated for drug users, drug addicts, and after -drug detoxifications.

12. Other prohibited acts due to drug -related laws.

relevant_article.law_id: Law on Drug Prevention and Control 2021
relevant_article.article_text:
Responsibility of individuals and families

1. Propagating and educating members of the family and relatives about the harmful effects of drugs and implementing the provisions of the law on drug prevention and control;manage and prevent family members violating the law on drug prevention and control.

2. To comply with the instructions of the competent person on the use of addictive drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursors, and veterinary drugs containing narcotic and precursors.

3. Cooperating with functional agencies in the struggle with criminals and drug evils;Participate in supporting voluntary drug detoxification activities at home, community, drug detoxification at drug detoxification and treatment of opium forms with alternative drugs;monitor and help the post -detoxification person to integrate into the community;Prevention and control of drug relapse.

4. Provide timely information on criminals, drug evils and planting trees containing narcotics to the police or competent state agencies;Participate in removing trees containing narcotics organized by local authorities.

Responsibilities of state agencies

1. Organizing drug prevention and control in agencies and units;prevention and prevention of cadres, civil servants, officials and employees under the management and officers and soldiers of the people's armed forces violating the law on drug prevention and control;Propagating and mobilizing people to detect, denounce and fight against crimes and drug evils.

2. To organize the implementation of the State's guidelines and policies on socio -economic development and development to replace the planting of trees containing narcotics in areas of removal of narcotic containers.

Applying drug detoxification methods for Vietnamese people to be expelled by foreign countries due to illegal use of narcotics and drug addiction;Foreigners addicted to drugs living in Vietnam

1. Vietnamese people were expelled by foreign countries to Vietnam due to illegal use of drugs and drug addiction when returning home to determine the status of drug addiction.In case of being identified as drug addiction, he or she must take measures to detoxify drugs in accordance with this Law.

2. Foreigners who are addicted to drugs living in Vietnam are responsible for registering for voluntary drug detoxification at the drug detoxification facility in accordance with this Law and must pay all the expenses of contacts.related to detoxification.In case of failure to perform voluntary drug detoxification, they are handled according to the provisions of law.

1. The State applies appropriate detoxification measures for drug addicts who are detained, prisoners, compulsory educational institution camp, and students of reformatory schools.

2. Superintendent of detention camps, temporary detention, custody houses, mandatory educational institutions director, principal of reformatory schools closely coordinate with local health facilities to implement regulations inClause 1 of this Article.

1. All citizens are equal, not discriminated in the exercise of information access rights.

2. Information provided must be accurate and complete.

3. The provision of information must be timely, transparent and convenient for citizens;in accordance with the order and procedures as prescribed by law.

4. The restriction of information access must be prescribed by law in case of necessity for national defense, national security, social order and safety, social ethics, and the health of the community.

5. The exercise of the right to access to citizens' information must not infringe on national and national interests, legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations or others.

The subject exercise the right to access information

Citizenship information is approached

How to access information

Citizens have access to information in the following methods:

1. Freedom to access information publicly by state agencies;

2. Requesting the State agency to provide information.

1. Deliberately providing false, incomplete information, delayed information provision;information damage;Forging information.

2. Provide or use information against the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, sabotage solidarity policies and incite violence.

b) Information, false, wrongly infringed to honor, reputation, dignity or causing damage to the legitimate rights and interests of other agencies, organizations and individuals.

Subjects of application
1. Agencies, organizations and individuals of Vietnam activities on tourism in Vietnam and abroad.

2. Foreign organizations and individuals operating tourism on the territory of Vietnam.

3. State management agencies on tourism, other agencies, organizations, individuals and communities with tourism -related activities.

Explain words
In this law, the words below are understood as follows:

1. Tourism is activities related to the trip of people outside the place of residence regularly for no more than 1 consecutive year to meet the needs of sightseeing, relaxation, entertainment, learning, examination, examinationBreak tourism resources or combine with other legal purposes.

2. Tourists are travelers or traveling to travel, except for school and work to get income at destination.

3. Tourism activities are activities of tourists, organizations and individuals in tourism business and agencies, organizations, individuals and communities related to tourism.

4. Tourism resources are natural landscapes, natural elements and cultural values ‚Äã‚Äãas a basis for forming tourism products, tourist areas, tourist destinations, in order to meet tourism needs.Tourism resources include natural tourism resources and cultural tourism resources.

5. Tourism products are a collection of services on the basis of exploiting tourism resources to satisfy the needs of tourists.

6. Tourism area is an area with advantages in tourism resources, planned and developed to meet the diverse needs of tourists.The tourist area includes the provincial tourist area and the national tourist area.

7. Tourist destination is a place where tourism resources are invested and exploited to serve tourists.

8. Tourism program is a document showing the schedule, service and price predetermined for tourists from the starting point to the end of the trip.

9. Travel service business is the construction, sale and organization of part or the whole tourism program for tourists.

10. Travel guidance is an activity to provide information, connect services, lead tourists, support tourists to use services according to the travel program.

Scope of regulation and duties of the Law on Administrative Procedure

The Law on Administrative Procedure stipulates the basic principles in administrative proceedings;duties, powers and responsibilities of the procedure -conducting agency, the person conducting the proceedings;rights and obligations of participants in proceedings, agencies, organizations and individuals involved;The order and procedures for suing, settling administrative cases, administrative judgment execution and settlement of complaints and denunciations in administrative procedures.

The Law on Administrative Procedure contributes to the protection of justice, protecting human rights, citizenship, protecting the socialist regime, protecting the interests of the State, the legitimate rights and interests of agencies and groupsofficials and individuals;educate people to strictly abide by the law;ensure stability, smoothness and effectiveness of the national administration.

Subjects of application and validity of administrative procedure law

1. The Law on Administrative Procedure is applied to all administrative proceedings on the territory, including the mainland, islands, the sea and the airspace of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.

2. The Law on Administrative Procedure is applied to administrative proceedings activities conducted by the representative agency of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam abroad.

3. The Law on Administrative Procedure is applied to the settlement of administrative cases with foreign elements;In case the international treaty in which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member with a different regulation, the provisions of that international treaty are applied.

4. Foreign agencies, organizations and individuals, international organizations are entitled to preferential, diplomatic exemption and exemption rights or incentives and consular exemptions under Vietnamese law or national treaties.If the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member, the content of the administrative case is related to such agencies, organizations and individuals are resolved by diplomatic path.

3. 4. The administrative act of being sued is the act in Clause 3 of this Article, which affects the implementation of legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals.

The Court of Collective Administrative Case and the decision by the majority, except for the case of shortened procedures.

1. In administrative proceedings, everyone is equal before the law, regardless of ethnicity, gender, belief, religion, social composition, cultural level, occupation and social status.

2. All agencies, organizations and individuals are equal in the exercise of rights and obligations in administrative proceedings before the Court.

3. The Court is responsible for creating conditions for agencies, organizations and individuals to exercise their rights and obligations.

The Court is responsible for conducting a dialogue and creating favorable conditions for the litigants to dialogue with each other about the settlement of the case in accordance with this Law.

1. In the course of the Court to resolve the administrative case, the litigant has the right and obligation to hand over documents and evidence to the Court;If the litigant does not submit or submit the documents and evidence required by the Court without plausible reasons, the Court is based on the documents and evidence that the involved parties have handed over and the Court has collected.According to the provisions of Clause 2, Article 84 of this Law to resolve the case.

2. The involved parties handed over documents and evidence to the Court must be recorded.In the minutes, the name, form, content, characteristics of documents and evidence;number of copies, pages of documents, evidence and time of receipt;Signature or point of handover, signature of the recipient and the trail of the Court.The minutes must be made in two copies, one saved to the administrative case file and one assigned to the litigant to submit documents and evidence.

5. In case the documents and evidence have been handed over yet to ensure sufficient basis to resolve the case, the judge requests the involved parties to submit additional documents and evidence.

The statute of limitations for suing

1. The statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit is the deadline that agencies, organizations and individuals may initiate a lawsuit to request the Court to resolve the administrative case to protect the lawful rights and interests;If that time limit ends, the right to sue.

2. The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits for each case is as follows:

a) 01 year from the date of receiving or knowing the administrative decisions, administrative acts, disciplinary decisions forced jobs;

b) 30 days from the date of receiving the decision to settle complaints about the decision to handle the competition case;

c) From the date of receipt of the notice of complaint settlement of the voter list or ending the deadline for settlement of complaints without receiving the noticeTri came 05 days before the election.

3. In case the litigant complains in accordance with the law to the State agency or person competent to settle complaints, the statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit is prescribed as follows:

a) 01 year from the date of receiving or knowing the first decision to settle complaints or the second complaint settlement decision;

b) 01 year from the expiry of the time limit for settling complaints in accordance with the law that state agencies and competent people do not resolve and have no written response to the complainant.

4. In case of force majeure events or other objective obstacles, the petitioner cannot initiate a lawsuit within the time limit prescribed at Points a and b, Clause 2 of this Article, the time for force majeure events orOther objective obstacles are not counted in the statute of limitations.

5. The provisions of the Civil Code on how to determine the term and statute of limitations are applied in administrative proceedings.

Procedures of lawsuits

1. When initiating an administrative lawsuit, agencies, organizations and individuals must file a lawsuit in accordance with Article 118 of this Law.

2. Individuals who have adequate administrative acts can or ask others to make a lawsuit.In the name of the name and address of the petitioner in the application, the full name and address of the individual;At the end of the personal application, signs or points are signed.

3. Individuals who are minors, people who lose civil act capacity, people with limited civil act capacity, people with difficulties in awareness and control of behavior, their legal representativeMay be or ask others to make a lawsuit.In the name of the name and address of the petitioner in the application, the full name and address of the individual's legal representative;At the end of the application, the legal representative must sign or point.

4. Individuals in the case specified in Clauses 2 and 3 of this Article are non -literate, unable to see, cannot make a lawsuit, cannot sign by themselves or point themselves.Other than making a lawsuit and must have people with full administrative proceedings with witnesses, signing certifications in the petition.

5. Agencies and organizations are the lawsuits, the legal representative of that agency or organization may or ask others to make a lawsuit against the case.In the name and address of the petitioner, the name and address of the agency, organization and full name and name of the legal representative of that agency or organization;At the end of the application, the legal representative of the agency or organization must sign and seal of that agency or organization;In case the lawsuit organization is an enterprise, the use of seals in accordance with the Enterprise Law.

Determine the date of initiating an administrative case

1. In case the petitioner directly submits the application at the competent court, the lawsuit date is the date of application.

2. In case the petitioner sends an online application, the date of lawsuit is the date of application.

3. In case the petitioner submits the application to the Court via postal service, the lawsuit date is the sign of the postal service organization where it is sent.In case of failure to determine the date, month and year by posting the post, the date of the lawsuit is the date the involved parties send an application at the postal service organization.The involved parties must prove that the date they send the application at the postal service organization;In case the litigant fails to prove, the date of lawsuit is the day the Court receives a petition delivered by the postal service organization.

4. In case of transferring a case to other courts as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 34 and Clause 3, Article 165 of this Law, the date of lawsuit is the date of sending the petition to the Court that has accepted but not in accordance with the authority and isDetermined according to the provisions of Clauses 1, 2 and 3 of this Article.

Receive and review the petition

1. The Court receives the petition filed by the petitioner directly at the Court's Application Department or sent via postal service and recorded in the application book.In case of receiving an online application, the Court prints the paper version and records the application book.

The receipt of the petition is recorded in the application book and notice on the Court's electronic portal (if any).

When receiving the petition to submit directly, the Court is responsible for granting the certificate immediately received the petitioner.In case of receiving an online application, the Court responded to the petitioner through the email.In case of receipt of applications via postal service, within 02 working days from the date of receipt, the Court must send a notice of receipt to the petitioner.

2. Within 03 working days from the date of receiving the petition, the Chief Justice of the Court assigns a judge to consider the petition.

3. Within 03 working days from the date of assignment, the judge must consider the petition and have one of the following decisions:

a) Request amendments and additions of lawsuits;

b) Carry out procedures for accepting the case according to the usual procedure or according to the shortened procedure if the case is eligible for the specified in Clause 1, Article 246 of this Law;

c) Transfer the lawsuit to the competent court and notify the petitioner if the case is under the jurisdiction of other courts;

d) Return the petition to the petitioner, if one of the cases prescribed in Clause 1, Article 123 of this Law.

4. The results of the judges' handling of the judge specified in Clause 3 of this Article must be notified to the petitioner, which must be noted in the application book and notice on the Court's electronic portal (if any).

Complaints, petitions and settlement of complaints, petitions on returning the petition

1. Within 07 days from the date of receiving the written return of the petition, the petitioner has the right to complain, the Procuracy has the right to propose to the Court that has returned the petition.

2. Immediately after receiving the complaints and petitions on the return of the petition, the Chief Justice of the Court must assign a judge to consider and settle complaints and petitions.

3. Within 05 working days from the date of assignment, the judge must open a meeting to consider and settle complaints and petitions.The meeting reviewed, resolved complaints, proposed the participation of representatives of the Procuracy of the same level and the litigant with complaints.In case the petitioner, the procurator is absent, the judge still conducts the meeting.

4. Based on documents and evidence related to the return of the petition, the opinion of the Procuracy representatives and the petitioner with complaints at the meeting, the judge must make one of the following decisionsThis:

a) Maintain the return of the petition and notify the petitioner, the Procuracy of the same level;

b) Receive a petition and documents and evidence to conduct the acceptance of the case.

5. Within 07 days from the date of receiving the decision to answer the complaint, the petition about the return of the judge's petition, the petitioner has the right to complain, the Procuracy has the right to propose to the Chief JusticeThe court on one level directly considered and resolved.

6. Within 10 days from the date of receiving the complaint, the proposal to return the petition, the Chief Justice of the Court on a direct level must make one of the following decisions:

a) Maintain the return of the petition;

b) Request the first -instance Court to receive a lawsuit and documents and evidence attached to the acceptance of the case.

The decision to settle complaints and recommendations of the Chief Justice of the Court on a direct level is the final decision.This decision must be sent immediately to the petitioner, the Procuracy of the same level, the Procuracy petitioned and the Court issued a decision to return the petition.

Hearing the case

1. After receiving the petition and documents and evidence, if it is considered to be under the jurisdiction of the Court, the judge must notify the petitioner to let them pay the court fee advance;In case the petitioner is exempted from paying the court fee advance or not having to pay the court fee advance, notify the petitioner to know about the acceptance of the case.

Within 10 days from the date of receiving the notice of payment of the court fee advance, the petitioner must pay the court fee advance and pay the receipt to the Court.

2. The judge accepts the case on the day the petitioner submits the receipt of the court fee advance.In case the petitioner is exempted from paying the court fee advance or not having to pay the court fee advance, the date of acceptance of the case is the date the Judges shall notify the petitioner to accept the acceptance.The acceptance of the case must be recorded in the acceptance book.

3. In case of expiry of the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article that the newly petitioner submits to the Court of receipt of the court fee advance, the settlement is as follows:

a) In case the petition has not returned, the judge shall handle the case;

b) If the petition has returned, the petitioner proves that they have paid the court fee advance on time, but because of force majeure or objective obstacles, they submit the receiptThe advance of the court fees for the Court was improperly shown that the judge asked them to submit a petition, documents and evidence and proceed to accept the case;In this case, the date of lawsuit is the first date of filing a lawsuit;

c) In case the judge returns the petition, the petitioner will pay the advance of the court fee and submit the receipt of the court fee advance to the Court, otherwise becauseThe judge asked them to submit a petition, documents and evidence to accept the case;In this case, the lawsuit date is the date of submission of the lawsuit.

4. In case of expiry of the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article that the petitioner does not submit to the Court of receipt of the court fee advance, the Court informs them about not accepting the case on the grounds thatThey do not pay for the advance of the court fee.In this case, the petitioner has the right to file a lawsuit if the statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit remains.

5. After the judge accepts the case that the Court receives an independent request from the person with related rights and obligations as prescribed in Article 129 of this Law to resolve in the same administrative case,The date of acceptance of the case is determined as follows:

a) In case the person with the interests and obligations are exempted or not to pay the court fee advance, the date of accepting the case is the day the Court receives an independent request of the person with the rights and obligations of the inter -inter -obligations and obligations.officials and documents and evidence attached;

b) In case the person with related rights and obligations must pay the court fee advance, the date of accepting the case is the day the person with related rights and obligations shall submit to the Court of the Court of Collection of Project Advanced Fees;

c) In case there are many people with relevant rights and obligations that require independence, the date of accepting the case is the day the Court receives the last independent request, if they are all exempted or not.Must pay for the court fee advance or the last date for the Court to receive the court fee advance fee, if they fall into the case of paying the court fee advance.

6. When receiving the receipt of the litigant's advance fee, the Court must issue them a certificate of receipt of the receipt of the court fee advance.

Assigning Judges to solve the case

1. On the basis of the judge's reporting report, assigned to accept the case, the Chief Justice of the Court decided to assign the judge to resolve the case to ensure the principle of impartial, objective and random principles.

2. Within 03 working days from the date of accepting the case, the Chief Justice of the Court decides to assign a judge to resolve the case.

For complicated cases, the settlement may have to be extended, the Chief Justice of the Court assigns the alternate judge to ensure the trial in accordance with the provisions of this Law.

3. In the process of settling the case, if the assigned judge cannot continue to carry out the task, the Chief Justice of the Court assigns another judge to continue the task;In case of trial without alternate judges, the case must be re -tried from the beginning and notify the litigants and procuracies of the same level.

Rights and obligations of the notified person

1. Within 10 days from the date of receipt of the notice, the person who is sued, the person with the interests and obligations of the relevant must submit to the Court written a written record of his opinion on the request of the petitioner and the document and the document., evidence attached or independent requirements (if any).

In case of extension, the notice of the person must apply for an extension to the Court stating the reason;If the extension application is grounded, the Court is extended once, but not more than 07 days.

2. In case the person who is sued, the person with relevant interests and obligations has received the notice, but does not submit in writing within the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article without a good reason, the CourtThe case continues to settle the case in accordance with this Law.

3. The person who is sued, the person with relevant rights and obligations has the right to request the Court for the notes, how to take a lawsuit and documents and evidence attached to the petition (if any), except for documents,evidence specified in Clause 2, Article 96 of this Law.

4. Within 10 days from the date of receipt of the notice, the Procuracy assigns the Procurator and the Alternate Procurator (if any) to perform the tasks and notify the Court.

The right to independently require the person with related rights and obligations

1. In case the person with related rights and obligations do not participate in the proceeding with the lawsuit or the lawsuit, they have the right to request independence when there are the following conditions:

a) The settlement of cases related to their rights and obligations;

b) Their independence requirements are related to the case being resolved;

c) Their independence requirements are resolved in the same case, making the case resolution more accurate and faster.

2. Persons with related rights and obligations have the right to make an independent request to the time of opening a meeting to check the handover, approach, publicity of evidence and dialogue.

The procedure for independent requirements shall comply with the provisions of this Law on the lawsuit procedure of the petitioner.

The duties and powers of the judge in the trial preparation phase

1. Making case files.

2. To request the involved parties to submit additional documents, evidence and written comments on the requirements of the petitioner to the Court;Ask the petitioner to submit copies of documents and evidence for the Court to send to the litigant.

3. Verify and collect documents and evidence in accordance with this Law.

4. Deciding on the application, change and cancellation of temporary emergency measures.

5. To organize a meeting to check the handover, approach and publicity of evidence and dialogue in accordance with this Law;Except for the case according to the shortened procedure and the case of lawsuits on the list of voters.

6. Make one of the following decisions:

a) Bringing the case to trial;

b) Temporarily suspend the settlement of the case;

c) Suspension of the case settlement.

Make an administrative case file

1. The administrative case dossier includes the application and documents and evidence of the litigants and other participants in the proceedings;Documents and evidence collected by the Court related to the case;Procedure documents of the Court and Procuracy on the settlement of administrative cases.

2. The papers and documents in the administrative case file must be numbered, arranged in the order of date, month and year and must be kept, managed and used in accordance with the law.

Send records to the Procuracy

The Court must send the case file along with sending the decision to bring the case to the trial to the Procuracy of the same research level.Within 15 days from the date of receiving the case file, the Procuracy must return the case file to the Court.

General requirements for the first instance trial

The first instance trial must be conducted on time, the location was recorded in the decision to bring the case to trial or in the notice of reopening the trial in case of postponing the trial.

Deadline for opening trials

Within 20 days from the date of the decision to bring the case to trial, the Court must open the trial;In case of plausible reasons, the time limit for opening the trial may last but not more than 30 days.

The venue for the trial

The trial is held at the Court headquarters or maybe outside the Court headquarters but must ensure the solemnity and the form of courtroom specified in Article 151 of this Law.

Form of courtroom arrangement

1. Quoc Huy The Socialist Republic of Vietnam is hung in the middle of the courtroom and above the seat of the Trial Council.

2. The courtroom must have areas arranged separately for the Trial panel, procurators, trial secretary, litigants, people who protect the legitimate rights and interests of the litigants, participants.Other chanting and attendees.

Direct trial, verbal

1. The trial of words and must be conducted in the courtroom.

2. The trial panel must directly identify the details of the case at the trial by asking and listening to present and direct debate about the details and evidence of the case of the petitioner, the person who is suedPersons with rights and obligations related to the case, legal representative, who protects the legitimate rights and interests of the involved parties and other participants in the proceedings, agencies and organizations are invited to attend the sessionCourt, listening to the Procurator speaking of the Procuracy's opinion.

Trial rules

1. When entering the courtroom, everyone must abide by the security inspection of the force to protect the trial.

2. It is strictly forbidden to carry weapons, weapons, explosives, fire, toxins, radioactive substances, prohibited objects of circulation, single transmission, slogan and other documents and objects that affect the dignity of the sessionThe court entered the courtroom, except for the evidence of the case for the trial or weapons and support tools brought by the competent person to protect the trial.

3. Participants at the request of the Court must present the summons, invitations, and other relevant papers to the trial secretary at the secretary at the latest, 15 minutes, before the opening of the trial.and sit in the right position in the courtroom under the guidance of the trial secretary;In case of late arrival, there must be a summons, invitations, and other relevant papers to the trial secretary through the task force to protect the trial.

4. Journalists attending the trial to report on the evolution of the trial must obey the control of the presiding judge about the operating area.Journalists recorded and recording photos of the Trial panel must be approved by the presiding over the trial.The recording of words and images of the litigants, other participants in the proceedings must be agreed.

5. Everyone attending the trial must have a serious costume;There is an attitude of respect for the trial panel, keeping order and obeying the control of the presiding judge.

6. Do not wear hats, hats, stained glass in the courtroom, except for the case of plausible reasons and allowed by the presiding judge;Do not use mobile phones in the courtroom;No smoking, no food in the courtroom or other behaviors affecting the solemnity of the trial.

7. Participants at the request of the Court must be present at the trial during the trial of the case, except for the case of the presiding judge agreed to leave the courtroom if there is a good reason..

People under sixteen years old must not enter the courtroom, except for the case of the court summoned to the trial.

8. Everyone in the courtroom must stand up when the trial panel entered the courtroom and when sentenced, except for the consent of the presiding judge.

9. Only those who are agreed by the Trial Council will be asked, answered or spoke.The questioner, answering or speaking must stand up, except for the case for health reasons that the presiding judge agrees to sit, answer or speak.

Composition of first instance trial panel

The first -instance trial panel consists of a judge and 02 people's jurors, except for the case specified in Clause 1, Article 249 of this Law.The first -instance trial panel may include 02 judges and 03 people's jurors in the following case:

1. Complaints of administrative decisions and administrative acts of provincial -level People's Committees and presidents of provincial -level People's Committees related to many subjects;

2. complicated case.

The presence of members of the Trial Panel and Court Secretary

1. The trial is only conducted when there are sufficient members of the trial panel and the Secretary of the trial.

2. In case a judge, the people's jury is absent or cannot continue to participate in the trial of the case but the judges and the venic people's jurors participate in the trial from the beginning, these people are replaced into the city.The trial panel is absent to participate in the trial of the case.

3. In case there is no judges or alternate people's jurors to replace members of the Trial panel in accordance with Clause 2 of this Article, the trial must be postponed.

4. If the secretary of the trial is absent or cannot continue to participate in the trial without a replacement, the trial must be postponed.

The presence of procurators

1. The procurator was assigned by the Director of the Procuracy at the same level to participate in the trial, if absent, the Trial Council still conducts the trial.

2. In case the procurator is changed at the trial or cannot continue to participate in the trial, but with alternate prosecutor, this person is entitled to the trial of the case if they are present atThe trial from the beginning.

The presence of witnesses

1. Witnesses are obliged to participate in the trial according to the Court's summons to present the details of the case they know.In case the witness is absent, but before that, there was a direct testimony to the Court or sending testimony to the Court, the presiding judge announced that testimony.

2. In case the witness is absent, the trial panel decides to postpone the trial or still conduct the trial.In case the witnesses are absent from the trial, there is no good reason and their absence interfere with the trial, it may be taken to the trial according to the decision of the Trial Council.

The presence of the assessor

1. The assessor is obliged to participate in the trial according to the Court's summons to clarify issues related to the assessment and conclusion of the assessment.

2. In case the assessor is absent, the trial panel decides to postpone the trial or still conduct the trial.

Issuing, sending excerpts of judgments and judgments

1. Within 03 working days from the end of the trial, the involved parties are granted the judgment by the Court.

2. Within 07 days from the date of the sentence, the Court must issue and send the judgments to the litigants and the Procuracy of the same level.

3. Within 30 days from the expiry of the appeal and protest without appeal, appeal, the Court issued, and sent the judgments that have taken legal effect to the litigant, the Procuracy of the same level,Civil judgment enforcement agencies of the same level, direct superior agencies of the defendant.

4. The first instance judgment of the first -instance court is published on the Court's electronic portal (if any), except for the Court's judgment containing the information specified in Clause 2 of the Article96 of this law.

Repairing and supplementing the judgments and decisions of the Court

1. After the judgment or decision of the Court is issued, it is not repaired or supplemented, except for cases of clear spelling errors, data due to confusion or wrong calculations.The repair and supplementation document must be sent to the involved parties and the Procuracy of the same level immediately;In case the judgment or decision has taken legal effect, it must also be sent to the civil judgment enforcement agency of the same level, the direct superior agency of the person who is sued.

2. The repair and supplementation of the judgments and decisions specified in Clause 1 of this Article shall be carried out by the judges in coordination with the members of the case trial panel or judge of the presiding meeting.In case one of the members of the Trial Panel or the judge of the meeting in the meeting could not carry out the repair and supplement, the repair and supplementation was carried out by the Chief Justice of the Court.

Receive a lawsuit and accept the case

Immediately after receiving the petition of the list of voters, the Chief Justice of the Court assigned a judge to accept the case.

Deadline for settlement of the case

1. Within 02 days from the date of accepting the case, the judges assigned to accept the case must make one of the following decisions:

a) Decision to bring the case to trial;

b) Suspend the case and return the petition.

2. After issuing the decision to bring the case to trial, the Court must immediately send that decision to the litigant and the Procuracy of the same level.

3. Within 02 days from the date of issuing the decision to bring the case to trial, the Court must open a trial.

The presence of the litigant, the representative of the Procuracy

The involved parties, the Procurator of the Procuracy of the same level must be present at the trial, if absent, the Trial panel still conducts the trial of the case.

Apply other provisions of this Law

Other provisions of this Law are applied to resolve administrative cases for complaints about the list of voters in case this chapter does not specify, except for the regulations on postponing the trial, sending the case file to the case.The Procuracy researched before opening the trial and regulations on appellate procedures, cassation and re -jurisdiction.

The validity of the judgment, the decision to suspend the case of the Court

1. The judgments and decisions to suspend the case settlement of complaints on the list of voters takes effect immediately.The litigant has no right to appeal, the Procuracy has no right to protest.

2. The Court must immediately send the judgments and decisions to suspend the case to the litigants and the Procuracy of the same level.

The person has the right to appeal

The involved parties or legal representatives of the litigants have the right to appeal the judgments, decisions to suspend, suspend the settlement of the case of the first -instance Court to request the appellate court to resolve it according to the player.Appellate custom.

a) Date, month and year apply for appeal;

b) Name and address;Phone number, fax, email address (if any) of the appeal;

c) To appeal all or part of the judgment or decision of the first -instance court has not taken legal effect;

d) Reasons for appeals and requests of appeals;

d) Signature or point of the appeal.

2. The appeal who is an individual with full administrative acts can make an appeal by himself.In the name and address of the appealed person in the application, the name and address of the litigant must appeal;At the same time, at the end of the appeal, the litigant must sign or point.

3. The appealed person specified in Clause 2 of this Article, if not appealed by themselves, may authorize others to represent them to appeal.In the name and address of the appealed person in the application, the full name and address of the authorized representative has appealed;Full name and address of the involved parties authorized and authorized documents;At the same time at the end of the appeal, the authorized representative must sign or point.

4. The legal representative of the litigant is the agency or organization may make an appeal by itself.In the name of the name and address of the appealer in the application, the name and address of the litigant must be the agency or organization;Full name and position of the legal representative of the litigant are agencies and organizations;At the same time at the end of the appeal, the legal representative must sign and seal of that agency or organization, in case the appeal is an enterprise, the use of seals as prescribed by the Law on BusinessKarma.

5.
