Youth

Young people are Vietnamese citizens from full 16 to 30 years old.

Scope

This Law stipulates the rights, obligations and responsibilities of young people;State policies for young people;responsibilities of agencies, youth organizations, other organizations, educational institutions, families and individuals for young people;State management of young people.

Subjects of application

This law applies to young people;Agencies, organizations, educational institutions, families and individuals.

The role, rights and obligations of the youth

1. Youth is a great social force, shocking, creative, leading in the renovation, construction and defense of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam;plays an important role in the cause of industrialization and modernization of the country, international integration and socialism.

2. Young people have citizens' rights and obligations according to the provisions of the Constitution and the law.

Principles of ensuring the exercise of the rights and obligations of the youth and the State's policies for young people

1. The rights and obligations of young people are recognized, respected, protected and guaranteed in accordance with the provisions of the Constitution and the Law.

2. Regardless of ethnicity, gender, social composition, beliefs, religions, cultural levels and occupations in exercising the rights and obligations of young people.

3. The State, organizations, educational institutions, families and individuals shall create conditions for young people to exercise their rights and obligations according to the provisions of the Constitution and the law.

4. State policies for young people must ensure the goal of developing young people;create conditions for young people to perform, rights, obligations, responsibilities and promote capacity;Built or integrated in policies of branches, fields and localities.

5. The formulation and implementation of the State's policies for young people must ensure the participation of young people;Respect, listen to young people's opinions and aspirations.

6. Supporting and creating conditions for Vietnamese youth abroad to participate in activities towards the Fatherland and preserve and promote the national cultural identity.

7. To promptly and strictly handle agencies, organizations and individuals that do not perform or comply with responsibilities in accordance with this Law.

Resources for implementing the State's policies for young people

1. The State ensures resources to formulate and organize the implementation of policies and for young people in accordance with the law.

2. Financial sources ensuring the implementation of policies for young people including the state budget;other legal support, aid, funding and contributions from domestic and foreign organizations, enterprises and individuals.

National Committee for Vietnamese Youth

1. The National Committee for Vietnam Youth is an organization of interdisciplinary coordination, with the function of consulting the Prime Minister on the youth work.

2. Tasks and powers of the National Committee on Vietnamese youth are prescribed by the Prime Minister.

Thanh Nien Month

1. March every year is young month.The Youth Month is organized to promote the spirit of shock, volunteering and creativity of young people to participate in activities for the benefit of the community, society and mobilize organizations and individuals to invest and develop in ThanhNien.

2. The Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union shall assume the prime responsibility and coordinate with the concerned agencies, organizations and individuals organizing the youth month activities.

3. The Government and local governments at all levels are responsible for creating conditions for mechanisms, policies and resources to support the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union of the same level to organize the youth month.The heads of agencies and organizations are responsible for creating favorable conditions and support for young people to participate in the activities of the Youth Month.

Dialogue with young people

1. The Prime Minister, the presidents of the People's Committees at all levels are responsible for dialogue with young people at least once a year on issues related to young people;The heads of agencies, organizations and units of the people's armed forces shall have to dialogue with young people at the request of the Youth Organization prescribed in this Law.

2. The person who is responsible for dialogue with the youth prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article directs the preparation of plannings, dialogue programs and publicly announced on the web portal, website or listed atThe headquarters of agencies, organizations and units is 30 days later on the date of organizing dialogue;settlement according to their competence or petitions to competent agencies to settle young people's recommendations through dialogue activities.

3. Within 10 days from the date of dialogue, the content of conclusions must be publicized on the web portal, websites or listed at the offices of agencies, organizations, units andsend to relevant agencies, organizations and units;In case the content of dialogue is complicated, related to many areas, this term is 15 days.

4. The Government details this.

Apply international treaties on children's rights to young people from full 16 years old to under 18 years of age

The State applies international treaties on children's rights that the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member of young people from full 16 years old to under 18 years of age suitable to Vietnam's conditions.

Responsibility for the Fatherland

1. Promoting the tradition of national construction and defense of the nation;Shocking, creative, leading in the renovation, construction and defense of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.

2. Ready to protect the Fatherland, protect independence, maintain sovereignty, national security, unity and territorial integrity;Take on the difficult, arduous and urgent work when the Fatherland requests.

3. Struggling with conspiracies and activities that harm harmful to the national and national interests.

Responsibility for the state and society

1. Exemplary observance of policies and laws and fulfill citizenship obligations

2. Participate in preserving social order and safety, national defense and national security.

3. Proactively propose ideas and initiatives in the process of formulating policies and laws;participate in state and social management.

4. Actively participate in propaganda and mobilize people to implement the Constitution and laws.

5. Building production and business production and business models;participate in environmental protection and activities for the benefit of the community and society.

6. Actively participate in child care, education and protection activities.

Responsibility for the family

1. Taking care of family happiness;preserve and promote the fine traditions of the Vietnamese family.

2. respect and filial piety to grandparents, parents and respect other family members;care and educate children in the family.

3. Actively prevent and control domestic violence, eliminate backward customs and practices of marriage and family.

Responsibility for yourself

1. Practicing morality, personality, cultural lifestyle, civilized behavior;Citizens responsibility, awareness of law observance;prevention and control of negative, social evils, illegal acts and social ethics.

2. Actively studying, improving the qualifications, knowledge and skills;Access, research, application of science and technology in practice.

3. Proactively learn about the labor market;Choose appropriate occupations and jobs;train sense of responsibility, labor discipline and professional style;Creativity, technical improvement in improving labor productivity.

4. Practicing, protecting, caring for health, physical and mental development;Equipping knowledge, life skills, reproductive health care skills, sexual health, disease prevention;do not abuse alcohol, beer;restrict the use of tobacco;do not use drugs, addictive substances and other stimulants that law prohibits;Preventing and combating harmful effects from cyberspace.

5. Actively participate in healthy cultural, physical training and sports movements;protect, preserve and promote national cultural identity;absorb the essence of human culture.

Academic and scientific research policy

1. Ensuring equality in access to education and creating conditions for young people to participate in scientific research.

2. Promulgating and ensuring the implementation of ethical education programs, ideals, national traditions, cultural lifestyle, life skills, and sense of law observance for young people.

3. Having credit policies, scholarships, exemption and reduction of tuition fees for young people in accordance with the law.

4. Encouraging and supporting young people to study and improve professional qualifications;The ability to create, research and apply scientific and technological advances.

5. Preferential and supporting organizations and individuals investing in scientific research and innovation activities of young people;Participate in training life skills and other necessary skills for young people.

Labor policy, employment

1. Consulting, career orientation, providing labor market information for young people;educate professional skills, professional ethics for young people;Make sure young people are not forced and exploited labor.

2. Create conditions for young people to have jobs;Create on -site jobs for young people in rural, mountainous and island areas suitable for each region and region, associated with each stage of development of the country.

3. Creating conditions for young people to borrow preferential loans from the National Fund for jobs and other legal credit to create jobs, develop production and business.

Start -up policy

1. Education, training of knowledge and skills for young people.

2. Providing information about the market;legal, scientific and technological support, investment promotion, human resource development;preferential loans from credit institutions as prescribed by law.

3. Encouraging and creating a favorable environment for young people to start creating science and technology applications.

4. Incentives and support for organizations and individuals to participate in providing services to support startups;Encourage the establishment of a startup fund for young people in accordance with the law

Policy on protection, care and health improvement

1. Consulting and supporting health improvement for young people;prevention and control of domestic violence, school violence, sexual abuse;Prevention of drugs, HIV/AIDS;Prevention of sexually transmitted diseases, other social diseases and risks affecting the physical and mental health of young people.

2. Ensuring young people to provide information, access to friendly services on protection, reproductive health care, sexual health;Be consulted, health examination before getting married

3. Encouraging organizations and individuals to invest, provide health services and health care for young people.

Policies on culture, physical training, sports

1. Encourage and support young people to participate in activities and creativity in culture, physical training and sports.

2. To create conditions for young people to actively participate in preserving and promoting the national cultural values ‚Äã‚Äãand absorbing the quintessence of human culture.

3. Propagating, disseminating and education to raise awareness and protect the safety of young people in cyberspace.

4. Encouraging organizations and individuals to invest in building cultural, physical training and sports institutions for young people.

Policy on national defense

1. Ensuring young people to be educated for national defense and security, patriotism, revolutionary heroism, the sense of building and defending the Fatherland.

2. Ensuring young people to perform military service;obligations to participate in the People's Public Security, militia and self -defense;participating in reserve military personnel and building national defense and people's security in accordance with the law.

3. Young people fulfill their military service and obligations to join the People's Public Security forces to support vocational training and other preferential policies as prescribed by law.

Policy for young people volunteering

1. Youth volunteering is a voluntary young man to participate in activities for the benefit of the community and society in accordance with the law.

2. The State promulgates policies for young volunteers as follows:

a) Create information channels for young people to access and participate in volunteer activities;

b) Develop programs and projects to bring young volunteers to work in areas with extremely difficult socio -economic conditions, borders and islands;

c) Encourage organizations and individuals to support young people to participate in volunteer activities for the benefit of the community and society.

3. The Government details this.

Policies for young people with talent

1. The State has policies to detect, train, foster, attract, respect and remove talented young people.

2. The head of the agency or organization is responsible for implementing policies for young people with talent in accordance with their functions, tasks and powers.

Policies for young people are ethnic minorities

1. Priority for young people who are ethnic minorities in learning, labor, employment, start -up, health care, physical training and sports.

2. Supporting young people as ethnic minorities preserving and promoting the national cultural identity, building a civilized lifestyle, struggling to eliminate backward customs and practices.

3. Prioritizing the selection of training, retraining and putting into the planning to create a source of leadership and management of cadres, civil servants and officials who are young ethnic minority people in agencies, organizations and applications.taste of the state.

4. Encourage businesses and organize priority to recruit young people as ethnic minorities.

Policy for young people from full 16 years old to under 18 years old

1. Ensuring the completion of education universalization in accordance with the law.

2. Priority, facilitating participating in cultural, physical training, sports, entertainment and entertainment suitable to the capabilities and ages for comprehensive development.

3. Training, advice on choosing occupations and jobs suitable for age.

4. Equipping knowledge and self -protection skills against the risk of physical and mental health;Ensuring supportive measures and interventions for young people from full 16 to under 18 years of age to live safely and healthy.

5. Ensuring the implementation of criminal, administrative and civil policies in accordance with the law.

6. Priority to quickly solve cases that damage the physical and mental young people from full 16 years old to under 18 years of age.

7. Encouraging organizations and individuals to detect, train and foster talents for young people from full 16 years old to under 18 years of age.

8. The Government stipulates mechanisms, policies and measures to implement policies for young people from full 16 years old to under 18 years of age.

Youth organization

1. The youth organization includes the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, the Vietnam Youth Union, the Vietnam Student Association and other organizations of the youth established, organized and operated in accordance with the regulations oflaw

2. Youth organization plays a role of unity, gathering young people, representatives to take care of and protect the legitimate and legitimate rights and interests of young people;Promote the role of young people in the cause of national construction and defense.

3. The youth organization is responsible for researching the needs and aspirations of young people to propose to competent agencies and organizations;coordinate with state management agencies on youth and relevant agencies in propaganda, education, implementation of policies and laws for young people;organize young people to participate in the movement for the benefit of the community and society, for the cause of building and defending the Fatherland.

Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union

1. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union is the socio-political organization of Vietnamese youth, playing a core role in the youth movement and youth organization;Organize guidance on activities of teenagers, children, in charge of the Ho Chi Minh Pioneering Youth Team.

2. The Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union is responsible for supervising and criticizing the social policies and laws on youth in accordance with the law;Summarize and reflect the opinions and recommendations of young people to competent agencies and organizations.

3. The Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union is responsible for participating and coordinating with relevant state agencies in the process of building, propagating and organizing the implementation of policies and laws for young people.

4. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union carries out the youth external activities.

Vietnam Youth Union and Vietnam Student Association

1. The Vietnam Youth Union is a widespread social organization of Vietnamese youth and the youth organization to unite and gather all Vietnamese youth classes to strive for the cause of building and protecting the group.Quoc.

2. The Vietnam Student Union is a social organization of Vietnamese students in order to unite and gather Vietnamese students to strive to study, train and contribute to the country.

3. Vietnam Youth Union, Vietnam Student Association is responsible for coordinating with the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union to participate in social supervision and criticism for youth policies and laws according to regulationslaw.

State policies for youth organization

1. To create conditions to organize young people to participate in formulating and implementing policies and laws for young people.

2. Ensuring conditions for youth to perform the tasks assigned by the State.

3. Supporting and creating favorable conditions for youth to mobilize young people to implement socio -economic development programs and projects and other programs and projects.

4. Agencies, organizations and units of the State are responsible for creating favorable conditions for the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union to organize social supervision and criticism activities in formulating and implementing policies and FranceLaw for young people.

Responsibility of the Vietnam Fatherland Front

1. Develop plans and programs to unify the actions of the Vietnam Fatherland Front on the collection, solidarity and promotion of young people.

2. Coordinate with the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union and other member organizations of the Vietnam Fatherland Front to implement the social monitoring and criticism program for the youth and public laws and laws.Youth.

3. Mobilizing members of the Vietnam Fatherland Front to take care of and protect the legitimate and legitimate rights and interests of young people.

Responsibility of social organizations

1. Mobilizing its members to create conditions for young people to study, labor, participate in cultural, physical training, sports, physical and intellectual development;fostering ethics, national traditions, citizens' consciousness;Leading in the work of creative labor and national defense.

2. Coordinate with state management agencies on young people in formulating and organizing the implementation of policies and laws for young people.

3. Coordinate with the Youth Organization to take care of and protect the legitimate and legitimate rights and interests of young people.

4. Support resources in accordance with the law and the charter of social organizations in order to develop the youth.

Responsibilities of economic organizations

1. Ensuring environmental environment, safe working conditions;Provide sufficient knowledge and information on occupational safety and hygiene for young people.

2. Taking care of the lives of young people;Support for employees to be young people studying and participating in cultural, physical training and sports activities;Health care and protection.

3. To create conditions for organizing the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, the Vietnam Youth Union to establish and operate.

4. Encouraging and supporting young people to start a business;vocational training, professional skills, life skills;Investing in building material facilities, physical training and sports for young people.

Responsibilities of educational institutions

1. Traditional education, morality, and healthy lifestyle for young people.

2. Building a safe, friendly and healthy educational environment;Take measures to prevent and combat school violence and sexual abuse for young people.

3. Promoting creativity in learning and scientific research;improve self -study capacity, practical skills;Consulting, career orientation for young people.

4. Psychological advice on social and school psychology;educate life skills, knowledge of care, health protection, reproductive health, sexual health, gender, skills to prevent and combat school diseases and social evils for young people.

5. Creating conditions for young people to participate in cultural activities, physical training, sports, entertainment, entertainment and other extracurricular activities.

6. To create conditions for organizing the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, the Vietnam Student Association to establish and operate.

Responsibility of the family

1. Respect, listen to the opinions and aspirations of young people;pay attention, education, encourage and create conditions for young people to exercise their rights, obligations and responsibilities in accordance with the law.

2. Respect the rights of young people in marriage and family;Gender education, gender equality and essential knowledge about marriage and family.

3. Taking care of and educating young people in physical, mental, intellectual, ethical and personality;Having a healthy cultural lifestyle, becoming a filial son of the family and citizens that are useful to society.

4. Practicing life skills for young people;educating the awareness and discipline of labor;Respect and create conditions for young people to choose their careers and find jobs.

5. Orientation, creating conditions for young people to access safe sources of information and protect young people on cyberspace environment.
